intro: Thysanocarpus laciniatus var. laciniatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thysanocarpus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often serrated along the edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom during the warmer months. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus Thysanocarpus. This species is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
